title: Add Playwright for web E2E testing
description:
Since this is a web-first MVP, add Playwright for end-to-end browser testing - both locally and in CI.

## Why
- Web is our primary target
- Playwright MCP plugin available for AI-assisted testing
- Catches real browser issues that unit tests miss
- Enables automated testing in GitHub Actions

## Local Setup
- Install Playwright: \`npx playwright install chromium\`
- Add Playwright MCP to \`.claude/settings.json\` for local testing
- Create \`test-data/\` directory with sample files for testing

## CI Integration (like lebenslauf-generator)

### In \`claude.yml\` workflow:
\`\`\`yaml
- name: Install Playwright
  run: npx playwright install chromium

- name: Run Claude Code
  uses: anthropics/claude-code-action@v1
  with:
    claude_args: |
      --mcp-config '{"mcpServers": {"playwright": {"command": "npx", "args": ["-y", "@anthropic-ai/mcp-server-playwright"]}}}'
      --allowedTools "...,mcp__plugin_playwright_playwright__*"
\`\`\`

### Subagent pattern for stability:
\`\`\`
Task(prompt="Start expo web, then test [specific feature] using Playwright MCP. Return a brief summary of results.", subagent_type="general-purpose")
\`\`\`

### PR review workflow:
- Auto-review PRs with mandatory Playwright testing
- Test only what changed, not the entire app
- Prefer \`browser_snapshot\` (text) over screenshots when possible

## Tasks
1. Install Playwright locally
2. Add Playwright MCP config to \`.claude/settings.json\`
3. Create \`test-data/\` directory
4. Add Playwright setup to \`claude.yml\` workflow
5. Add Playwright to \`claude-code-review.yml\`
6. Document testing workflow in CLAUDE.md

## Reference
See \`.github/workflows/claude.yml\` in lebenslauf-generator for full implementation.

title: Consistency calculation algorithm (60-day rolling window)
description:
Define and implement the consistency calculation that powers The Flame.

## Core Algorithm
- [ ] Calculate: (actual completions / expected completions) over rolling window
- [ ] Default window: 60 days
- [ ] Result: percentage 0-100

## Edge Cases
- [ ] New habits (<60 days): Use available days as denominator
- [ ] Habits started today: Show 0% or "Just started" state
- [ ] Weekly habits: Expected = weeks in window, not days
- [ ] Custom frequency: Calculate expected based on selected days

## The Flame Mapping
- [ ] Define percentage to Flame intensity mapping
- [ ] "Grows quickly": Fast response to improvement
- [ ] "Shrinks slowly": Gradual decline, forgiving

## Example Calculations
Daily habit, 60-day window:
- 60/60 completions = 100% (blazing)
- 45/60 completions = 75% (strong)
- 30/60 completions = 50% (medium)
- 6/60 completions = 10% (ember)

Weekly habit (1x per week), 60-day window (~8 weeks):
- 8/8 completions = 100%
- 6/8 completions = 75%

## Implementation
- [ ] Create calculateConsistency(habitId, windowDays) function
- [ ] Create getFlameIntensity(consistencyPercentage) function
- [ ] Optimize for performance (called frequently)
- [ ] Consider caching with smart invalidation

## Notes
- This replaces streaks as the PRIMARY metric
- Streaks can exist as secondary/optional stat

title: Challenge data model
description:
Design the challenge/reward data model.

## Challenge Properties
- id: string
- habitId: string (the habit being challenged)
- creatorId: string (friend who set the challenge)
- recipientId: string (person doing the habit)
- targetConsistency: number (e.g., 80 for 80%)
- periodDays: number (e.g., 60)
- rewardDescription: string (the shared experience)
- createdAt: Date
- endsAt: Date

## Challenge States
- active: Challenge is ongoing
- completed: Target was reached, time to celebrate!
- expired: Period ended without reaching target (NOT "failed" - no punishment)

## Reward Guidelines (from Vision)
Rewards are SHARED EXPERIENCES - things you do TOGETHER.

Valid examples:
- "Grab coffee together"
- "Go for a hike"
- "Play tennis"
- "Cook dinner together"
- "Watch a movie together"

Discouraged (transactional):
- "I'll buy you a gift"
- "I'll pay for dinner"
- Money or physical items

## Queries Needed
- Active challenges for a user
- Challenges on a specific habit
- Challenge history between two friends

## Notes
- NO "failed" state - we use "expired" (neutral, not punishing)
- Reward is a shared experience, not a transaction
- Links habit, creator, and recipient
